course.subject: HUMA
course.name: World Religions
course.description: This introductory course enables students to acquire basic understanding regarding history, practices and beliefs of six living religious traditions: including Taoism, Hinduism, Buddhism, Judaism, Christianity, and Islam. Students will learn how to appreciate the relevance of religion in modern culture.

reviews.author: sago
reviews.title: Relaxing course with good grade
reviews.comment_content:
Material covers:
- Hinduism
- Buddhism
- Eastern Religion (Confucianism, Daoism and Shinto)
- Belief and Faith
- Abrahamic Tradition (Judaism, Christianity and Islam)

It only covers brief introduction of the religions and their philosophy. The content is suitable for people who want to know more about different religions. Anyone in believe or know about them will be a huge plus.

The content is also interesting and thoughtful.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching uses powerpoint and has good presentations. Often ask open ended questions to make you think more. Also, you can ask question anytime.

The course take 3 hours each lecture with break. Often finish in 2 hours.

reviews.comment_workload:
Very few workload.

You do not need to read the readings to get good grades. Attending lectures is enough. Most question in quiz in more easier than teaching.

reviews.author: avv
reviews.title: Chill
reviews.comment_content:
Teaches the major religions in the world from a very philosophical standpoint

- Buddhism
- Hinduism
- Confucianism
- Shintoism
- Christianity
- Islam
reviews.comment_teaching:
The instructor was quite new, I assume he was a visiting prof.

A friendly American Prof. who encouraged discussion and asking questions although it wasn't a part of the grade due to the large class size.This is quite critical though in a philosophy class

reviews.author: Jamie So
reviews.title: Relaxing Course and good lecture
reviews.comment_content: About different religions and their thoughts including Taoism, Hinduism, Buddhism, Judaism, Christianity, and Islam.
reviews.comment_teaching: power point are provided for us including the background of the religion and reading materials are given sometime include in the power point. It will be easy to catch up and understand if attending classes. Professors teaching is good, he help us understand more about the context .
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance: 20%
Quizzes: 40%
Final Exam: 20%
Final Essay: 20%

Grading is good. I got only 50% but already have a grading of C while the mean is about 60-70%
reviews.comment_workload: Four quizzes, one per week, which the quizzes are easy, about three to four short question, fill in the blanks and matching.  Final essay are given one week to finish which hand in after the final exam, so there are enough time for us to complete it. the final exam format is similar to those quizzes, the difference is only the amount of short questions increase but still have enough of time to complete it. Time are not fixed in the quizzes and exam, you just have to ask for extra time to complete the quizzes and there are 3 hrs for the exam.
